0.context: Basilica Of The Sagrada Familia Known as the Europe continent's most unconventional churches, the Basilica of the Sagrada Familia is one of the best places to visit in Barcelona. Located in the northern section of the city, this church is surrounded by 18 colossal spindly towers which add a gothic charm to its overall appearance. As a visitor, the first thing which will make you is the impressive exterior of the church. It depicts the birth of Jesus, the sufferings he had to endure during his lifetime, his death, and the story of his resurrection. The interior of the church also looks quite stunning because of the ceiling and the unusual yet Crucifix. Location: 401 Carrer de Mallorca, Barcelona. Timings: 9 AM - 7 PM. Entry Fee: Starting at 14 Euro. Must Read: 20 Most Beautiful Cities In Spain. Get Spellbound By Them On A Trip. Europe Holiday Packages On TravelTriangle. Magnificent Switzerland Holiday Package. 0.summary: Basilica Of The Sagrada Familia is one of Barcelona's top attractions, known for its gothic architecture and 18 spindly towers. The church depicts key events in Jesus's life and has a stunning interior. Located at 401 Carrer de Mallorca, it is open from 9 AM to 7 PM with an entry fee starting at 14 Euro.

1.context: Casa Mila Also known as La Pedrera among the locals, Casa Mila is yet another architectural masterpiece of Antoni Gaudi. Established between the years of 1906 to 1912, this ostentatious structure looks more like a sensational piece of sculpture than a building because of its eloquently curved facades. Some other things which make it look even more elegant are its beautiful balconies and unique rounded windows. The gorgeous building of Casa Mila houses the famous cultural center Fundacio Catalunya which organizes numerous events. So if you are looking for some famous places to visit in Barcelona for kids, then Casa Mila would be ideal for you. Location: 261-265 Carrer de Provenca, Barcelona. Timings: 9 AM - 9 PM. Entry Fee: 21 Euro. Suggested Read: Spanish Travel Words And Phrases To Help One On A Trip To Spain And Latin America.
1.summary: Casa Mila, also known as La Pedrera, is a remarkable architectural piece by Antoni Gaudi with curved facades, beautiful balconies, and unique rounded windows. Located at 261-265 Carrer de Provenca, it houses the cultural center Fundacio Catalunya and is open from 9 AM to 9 PM with an entry fee of 21 Euro.

2.context: Palau De La Musica Catalana An opera hall, the Palau de la Musica Catalana is the creation of yet another famous Catalan artist and architect Lluis Domenech i Montaner. Known as the embodiment of Catalan Modernism, the exterior of this beautiful structure boasts exquisitely detailed mosaic work and decorative columns. On the other hand, the internal section of the opera house exhibits a graceful glass ceiling which during the day looks absolutely Owing to its ceiling, the concert hall stays completely illuminated by natural light during the daytime. So if you are a lover of both opera and architectural brilliance, then make sure to add the Palau hall to your list of places to see in Barcelona. Location: Calle Palau de la Musica, Barcelona. Timings: 10 AM - 3:30 PM. Entry Fee: Starting at 16 Euro. Suggested Read: 7 Reasons To Visit Spain At Least Once In Your Lifetime.
2.summary: Palau De La Musica Catalana is an opera hall designed by Lluis Domenech i Montaner, embodying Catalan Modernism. It features detailed mosaic work and a glass ceiling that illuminates the hall with natural light. Located at Calle Palau de la Musica, it is open from 10 AM to 3:30 PM with an entry fee starting at 16 Euro.

3.context: Barri Gotic The Gothic Quarter, also affectionately known as Barri Gotic, is the oldest yet liveliest part of Barcelona. If you visit here, then you will be able to savor the extravagant beauty of ancient Roman structures and picturesque plazas. Apart from this, the Gothic Quarter also houses numerous restaurants and cafes where you can spend some lively moments with your friends and family members. All in all, this place has almost everything that can make travelers happy and content. Due to this reason, most tourists consider it as one of the top places to visit in Barcelona. Location: Between the streets of Laietana and Rambla. Timings: Open 24X7. Entry Fee: Nil. Suggested Read: 15 Top Things To Do In Spain That Will Leave Your Soul Craving For More.
3.summary: Barri Gotic, or the Gothic Quarter, is Barcelona's oldest and liveliest area, featuring ancient Roman structures, picturesque plazas, restaurants, and cafes. Located between the streets of Laietana and Rambla, it is open 24/7 with no entry fee.

4.context: Casa Batllo Yet another modernist marvel created by Antoni Gaudi, Casa Batllo is the former townhouse of the famous Batlló family of Catalunya. With its enthralling adorning façade and the atypical shape, this architectural magnum opus looks quite similar to the castles described in the fairy tales. Because of its unusual design and structure, Casa Batllo has also earned the nickname of House of the Dragon, which in Spanish translates as Casa del Drac. Location: 43 Passeig de Gracia, Barcelona. Timings: 9 AM - 9 PM. Entry Fee: Starting at 22 Euro. Suggested Read: 7 Stupendous Cruises In Spain Revealing The Hidden Secret.
4.summary: Casa Batllo, designed by Antoni Gaudi, is known for its fairy tale-like façade and unusual shape. Also called Casa del Drac, it was the townhouse of the Batlló family. Located at 43 Passeig de Gracia, it is open from 9 AM to 9 PM with an entry fee starting at 22 Euro.

5.context: Casa Vicens Designed by the mastermind Antoni Gaudi, the beautiful house of Casa Vicens reflects the architectural style. Located in the calm neighborhood of Gracia, it is considered to be one of the most famous tourist places to visit in Barcelona. Casa Vicens was built between the years of 1883 to 1885 as a summer residence for the wealthy Vicens family. However, now it serves as a museum of Barcelona. Due to its unparalleled beauty and elegance, it earned the title of Unesco World Heritage in the year 2005. Location: Carrer de Les Carolines, 08012 Barcelona. Timings: 10 AM - 8 PM. Entry Fee: Starting at 12.50 Euro. Suggested Read: 8 Best Spanish Cuisines That Will Make You Fall In Love With Spain All Over Again.
5.summary: Casa Vicens, designed by Antoni Gaudi, is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Gracia. Built as a summer residence for the Vicens family between 1883 and 1885, it now serves as a museum. Located at Carrer de Les Carolines, it is open from 10 AM to 8 PM with an entry fee starting at 12.50 Euro.

6.context: Montjuic Castle If you are traveling to the capital of Catalunya for the first time and are looking for some places to visit in Barcelona for family, then make sure to add the mesmerizing Montjuic castle to your list. Situated at an elevation of 213 meters from the sea level, this majestic castle is known for its excellent panoramic views and gorgeous museums. The museums of the castle exhibit an outstanding collection of Catalan arts which will surely take your breath away. Location: 66 Carretera de Montjuic, Barcelona, Catalunya 8038, Spain. Timings: 10 AM - 8 PM. Entry Fee: 3 Euro. Suggested Read: 7 Cruises In Barcelona For You To Have A Luxurious Sea Retreat.
6.summary: Montjuic Castle, located at 66 Carretera de Montjuic, offers excellent panoramic views and houses museums with a collection of Catalan arts. Situated at an elevation of 213 meters, it is a must-visit for families. The castle is open from 10 AM to 8 PM with an entry fee of 3 Euro.

7.context: Museu d Art Contemporani De Barcelona MACBA Known as one of the best contemporary art museums in Barcelona, the MACBA showcases some of the exquisite art pieces of the modern era. It was designed and inaugurated by Richard Meier, a famous architect of America, in 1995. Since then, the museum has hosted many exhibitions by numerous artists of this century. Location: 1 Placa dels Angels, Barcelona, Catalunya 8001, Spain. Timings: 11 AM - 7:30 PM. Entry Fee: 11 Euro. Suggested Read: 8 Ravishing Water Parks In Barcelona To Stay Cool And Beat The Heat.
7.summary: Museu d'Art Contemporani de Barcelona (MACBA) is a top contemporary art museum showcasing modern era art pieces. Designed by Richard Meier, it opened in 1995 and hosts numerous exhibitions. Located at 1 Placa dels Angels, it is open from 11 AM to 7:30 PM with an entry fee of 11 Euro.

8.context: Picasso Museum Pablo Picasso has always been known for his excellent artistic brain and uncanny yet exquisite pieces of art. So if you are an art lover and want to relish his brilliance in Barcelona, then make sure to visit the Picasso Museum. By visiting here, you will get the rare chance to see the earlier works of the artistic mastermind and understand the relationship between him and Barcelona. Location: Carrer Montcada, Barcelona. Timings: 9 AM to 7 PM. Entry Fee: Starting at 7 Euro. Suggested Read: Barcelona In October Experience The Grandeur In The Rusty Colors Of Fall.
8.summary: Picasso Museum in Barcelona offers a rare chance to see the earlier works of Pablo Picasso and understand his relationship with the city. Located at Carrer Montcada, it is open from 9 AM to 7 PM with an entry fee starting at 7 Euro.

9.context: Museu d Historia De Catalunya As the name suggests, the Museu d'Historia de Catalunya showcases the rich historical background of the city of Barcelona. In this museum, you will find numerous paintings which depict the past of the Catalonia province, as well as numerous sculptures and relics which can help you to understand the city's cultural beauty. Location: Placa Pau Villa, 3, 08039 Barcelona, Spain. Timings: 10 AM - 7 PM. Entry Fee: 8 Euro. Suggested Read: Visit These 7 Places In Barcelona In April To Have An Incredible Summer Vacation.
9.summary: Museu d'Historia de Catalunya highlights Barcelona's rich historical background with paintings, sculptures, and relics. Located at Placa Pau Villa, it is open from 10 AM to 7 PM with an entry fee of 8 Euro.

10.context: Park Guell If you are looking for a few places to visit in Barcelona for family, the Park Guell would be absolutely ideal for you. The beautiful place currently rules over 42 acres of space and features almost every prop that any other park offers to its visitors. Along with elegant flashes of greenery, Park Guell also exhibits numerous swirling pathways where you can spend hours walking. Also, while you are here, make sure to visit the Sala Hipostila to savor the colorful essence of the beautiful city of Barcelona. Location: Carrer d'Olot, Barcelona. Timings: 8 AM - 9 PM. Entry Fee: 10 Euro. Suggested Read: 12 Indian Restaurants In Barcelona A Treat To Those Looking For Indian Cuisine In Spain.
10.summary: Park Guell is an ideal family destination, sprawling over 42 acres with greenery and swirling pathways. Located at Carrer d'Olot, it is open from 8 AM to 9 PM with an entry fee of 10 Euro.

11.context: Parc De La Ciutadella Located at the heart of Barcelona, Parc de la Ciutadella has always been one of the most famous gathering points of the city since its inception. In 1877, when it opened, it served only as a normal park for the local people. However, now it houses the famous Barcelona Zoo and the Catalan Parliament. Numerous people also come here during the day for exercising and walking. Location: 21 Passeig de Picasso, Barcelona. Timings: 10 AM - 10 PM. Entry Fee: Free. Further Read: Trekking In Spain 10 Best Places For Indulging In An Ultimate Adventure Like Never Before.
11.summary: Parc de la Ciutadella, located at the heart of Barcelona, is a popular gathering point featuring the Barcelona Zoo and Catalan Parliament. It is open from 10 AM to 10 PM with free entry.
